citation: Open-Source Psychometrics Project. (2019). Open Extended Jungian Type Scales (OEJTS). Retrieved from https://openpsychometrics.org/tests/OEJTS/
note: OEJTS provides open-source items for Jungian/MBTI type dimensions. Items map to atlas MBTI 8-factor structure (E/I, S/N, T/F, J/P as separate factors).

items.text: I feel comfortable in groups and like working in them
I am energized by interaction with others
I prefer to do things alone or with one or two people I feel comfortable with
I need time alone to recharge after social interaction
I focus on the reality of how things are, paying attention to details
I prefer to work with facts and concrete information
I focus on the big picture, looking for patterns and possibilities
I trust my hunches and pay attention to my impressions
I make decisions based on logic and objective analysis
I value justice and fairness over mercy when making decisions
I make decisions based on personal values and how actions affect others
I am concerned with harmony and making sure everyone is treated well
I like to have things decided and settled, preferring structure and plans
I am most comfortable when I can follow a schedule and know what to expect
I prefer to stay open to new information and options, keeping things flexible
I enjoy being spontaneous and adapting to whatever comes along
